'The Pirate Bay' (commonly abbreviated 'TPB') is a website providing torrent
files and magnet links to facilitate peer-to-peer file sharing using the
BitTorrent protocol. It was founded in Sweden in 2003.

In 2009, the websiteâs founders were put on trial in Sweden, charged with
facilitating illegal downloading of copyrighted material. They were found guilty
and sentenced to a year in prison with a fine of 30 million SEK (â¬2.7M or
US$3.5M as of 2009). In some countries, ISPs have been ordered to block access
to the website. Since then, proxies have been made all around the world
providing access to The Pirate Bay.
